meanings.definition: The act or state of floating.
meanings.sent1: The floatage of the boat made it easy to glide across the water.
meanings.sent2: The floatage of the leaves on the pond created a peaceful scene.
meanings.sent3: The floatage of the bubbles in the bathtub made it look like a fizzy potion.
meanings.sent4: The floatage of clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The floatage of the feather on the surface of the pond was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The amount of floating material in a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The floatage of debris after the storm was a sign of the damage caused.
meanings.sent2: The floatage of algae in the lake indicated poor water quality.
meanings.sent3: The floatage of fallen leaves in the river looked like a nature-inspired art installation.
meanings.sent4: The floatage of plastic bottles in the ocean highlighted the issue of pollution.
meanings.sent5: The floatage of icebergs in the Arctic was a majestic sight to behold.
